docs.text: Welcome to MkDocs For full documentation visit mkdocs.org . Commands mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project. mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server. mkdocs build - Build the documentation site. mkdocs help - Print this help message. Project layout mkdocs.yml # The configuration file. docs/ index.md # The documentation homepage. ... # Other markdown pages, images and other files.
docs.title: Welcome to MkDocs

docs.text: mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project. mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server. mkdocs build - Build the documentation site. mkdocs help - Print this help message.
docs.title: Commands

docs.text: mkdocs.yml # The configuration file. docs/ index.md # The documentation homepage. ... # Other markdown pages, images and other files.
docs.title: Project layout

docs.text: Get the toolchain (the less cancer way, I gave up using system package) $ wget -c http://www.codesourcery.com/sgpp/lite/arm/portal/package4571/public/arm-none-linux-gnueabi/arm-2009q1-203-arm-none-linux-gnueabi-i686-pc-linux-gnu.tar.bz2 $ mkdir ~/CodeSourcery $ tar -jxvf ~/arm-2009q1-203-arm-none-linux-gnueabi-i686-pc-linux-gnu.tar.bz2 -C ~/CodeSourcery/ $ echo export PATH=~/CodeSourcery/arm-2009q1/bin/:$PATH ~/.bashrc . ~/.bashrc Build the EV3-API next (please don't blindly copy stuff) cd ev3duder/EV3-API/API make Note the libev3api.a file created. Note down its path, then when compiling (e.g. test.c) arm-linux-blah test.c -L/path/to/lib -lev3api -I/path/to/lib -o test (L for linker, l for library, I for includes) Uploading the executable Refer to upload.sh
docs.title: Get the toolchain (the less cancer way, I gave up using system package)

docs.text: $ wget -c http://www.codesourcery.com/sgpp/lite/arm/portal/package4571/public/arm-none-linux-gnueabi/arm-2009q1-203-arm-none-linux-gnueabi-i686-pc-linux-gnu.tar.bz2 $ mkdir ~/CodeSourcery $ tar -jxvf ~/arm-2009q1-203-arm-none-linux-gnueabi-i686-pc-linux-gnu.tar.bz2 -C ~/CodeSourcery/ $ echo export PATH=~/CodeSourcery/arm-2009q1/bin/:$PATH ~/.bashrc . ~/.bashrc
